It is characterized by its slender, often multi-branched stems and small, clustered leaves that are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces yellow flowers in globular heads, which are often visited by bees and other pollinators. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it suitable for xeriscaping. The wood is hard and used locally for various purposes, including construction and fuel.
